reference.scope: X-RAY CRYSTALLOGRAPHY (2.25 ANGSTROMS) OF 351-683 IN COMPLEX WITH METAL IONS AND INHIBITOR

comment.text: Hydrolyzes the second messenger cAMP, which is a key regulator of many important physiological processes.
Binds 2 divalent metal cations per subunit. Site 1 may preferentially bind zinc ions, while site 2 has a preference for magnesium and/or manganese ions.

Isoform 1, isoform 2, isoform 6 and isoform 7 are inhibited by rolipram and cilomilast. Isoform 1, isoform 2 and isoform 6 are inhibited by 4-[(3-butoxy-4-methoxyphenyl)-methyl]-2-imidazolidinone (Ro 20-1724), roflumilast and denbufylline.
Purine metabolism; 3',5'-cyclic AMP degradation; AMP from 3',5'-cyclic AMP: step 1/1.
Isoform 1 interacts with LYN. Isoform 2 and isoform 6 interact weakly with LYN. Isoform 1, isoform 2 and isoform 6 interact with ARRB2.
Isoform 4 has propensity for association with membranes.

isoform.name: PDE4A8A
2EL
isoform.text: May be produced at very low levels due to a premature stop codon in the mRNA, leading to nonsense-mediated mRNA decay. Probably represents a non-functional splice isoform.

comment.text: Isoform 1 is widely expressed. Isoform 2 is abundant in liver, stomach, testis, thyroid and adrenal glands. It is also found in placenta, kidney, pancreas, ovary, uterus, skin, monocytes, mast cells, macrophages, as well as in bronchial smooth muscle. Isoform 6 is expressed at high levels in the heart and small intestine. It is also found in the brain, kidney, spleen, colon, salivary gland, ovary and peripheral blood lymphocytes. Isoform 7 is expressed predominantly in skeletal muscle and brain and at lower levels in the testis. Isoform 7 is expressed in the brain. Found in specific neuronal subpopulations in cortex, spinal cord and cerebellum (at protein level).

Phosphorylation by MAPKAPK2 its activation through PKA phosphorylation (By similarity). Phosphorylated at Ser-686 and Ser-688 when expressed in S.frugiperda cells. Isoform 2 and isoform 7 are activated by phosphorylation at Ser-119 and Ser-123 respectively by PKA.
Belongs to the cyclic nucleotide phosphodiesterase family. PDE4 subfamily.

property.value: P:regulation of protein kinase A signaling

feature.description: Glycyl lysine isopeptide (Lys-Gly) (interchain with G-Cter in SUMO)
